Annotation.note:
If $X$ is the symmetric, with respect to the internal bisector of the angle $A$, of the point of contact of the side $BC$ of the triangle $ABC$ and $D$ is the midpoint of $BC$, show that the line $DX$ and its two analogues $EY$, $FZ$ have a point in common. Is the proposition valid for an excircle?
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
